metadata.story_name:
A Massive cosmic entity threatens the east coast, bringing a threat completely unlike anything the world has ever seen. Furthermore, the world's most devious villains and most fiendish masterminds have joined this unfathomable being of evil. 

But this story is not about that conflict and you are not those legendary heroes. who have joined the fight against it.

The west Coast city of Emerald City Oregon used to be a hotbed of super-powered activity, but now, only the most pathetic and inept heroes and villains remain. 

The players take on the incompetent or pathetically weak Z-list heroes, and must defend Emerald city from equally inept and powerless villains.

=====

This game is meant to be a comedy superhero game in the style of Saturday morning cartoons. and it is meant to help teach beginners how to play Storium in a simple 3-scene short game.

each scene will be narrated by a different member of the Storium Arc podcast.

writing_prompt: When the most dangerous team of extreme accountants—the White Collar Gang—storms the second National Bank of Emerald City, demanding tax returns and ledgers, the few heroes left in town must decide: is this a fight worth taking, or is paperwork their true kryptonite?

metadata.story_name:
Menci Beach is a small port town along the coast of a beautiful ocean. Fisherman, sailors, shipwrights, carpenters, and all manner of people live in this town that thrives on the sea. 

But there are dangers from the ocean as well. Storms, waves, pirates, and the many dangerous creatures that can come up from the waves like sea wolves and flying rays. 

But of all the things Mencians fear most, the Kraken is the creature of their nightmares.

And there have been reports that it is awake again.

======

This story is a town defense story where players will play as inhabitants of Menci, as various threats threaten the town until perhaps the Kraken might arrive. 

This is a simple beginner game that will have 4 scenes and I hope to finish it quickly.

writing_prompt: A massive, sinking galleon drifts toward the docks, its crew fighting for survival amidst circling sharks and scattered cargo—how will the townsfolk balance saving lives, salvaging goods, and fending off disaster?

metadata.story_name:
Alissandra is a realm of floating waterways and floating islands called aviaries. The battles over them remain fierce as the high-tech, owl-like beings known as Avarians, of the Kichledai have captured and held many lands. 

It is time to take some of that back. A Hawk commander has convinced the Skyriver Republic to launch an attack on the Bronze Egg, a well-guarded Kichledai base but one that will give safe acess to much of Alissandra for the republic and others if the Avarians can be driven out. 

Now it is up to you, a group of sailors in the Skyriver republic’s navy to take and hold the base to put a serious halt to the Kichledai’s plans of expansion and conquest, while also giving the Hawks a small bit of their ancestral home back.


This is a naval warfare game in a fantasy world with steampunk elements, even though the naval battles will take place  on bodies of water suspended miles in the air by unknown forces. There will also be airships at least once. 

This game was inspired by the Alissandra world I created on “AI Dungeon”

writing_prompt: As the fleet sails into enemy waters, a proud hawk captain rallies a diverse crew of mages, wyvern riders, and Pegasus-mounted cavaliers, promising glory, trade routes, and a chance to reclaim a lost homeland—if they can survive the Kichledai navy.
